page.description: Capture an image using the camera, or from the photo library. On devices that don't support a camera, select an image from the filesystem. Action calls a function with the Image URI when the image has been obtained.

figure.title: The "Image Capture - Camera/Photo Library" action genie.

section.description: The Image Capture - Camera/Photo Library action is used with the UX component. This genie that appears when this action is selected allows you to set how you want to capture an image. On a device that has a camera, the image is captured using a camera. For devices that do not support a camera, you can choose an image from the filesystem. Camera access is either done using PhoneGap or HTML5. Once the image has been captured a Javascript event is fired.

case.title: Javascript to execute when image has been captured
case.description: Specify the Javascript to call once the image has been captured. Your Javascript can reference e.data. In the case

case.title: Image capture method
case.description: Specify the method for obtaining the image. If the component is running in a PhoneGap shell, then you can use PhoneGap to access the camera (if you are not in a PhoneGap shell, the user will get an error if they try to capture an image). If you select 'PhoneGapPreferred' then the PhoneGap method will be used if the component is running in a PhoneGap shell, otherwise the HTML5 method will be used.

case.title: Move file to permanent storage after capture
case.description: This property appears if the Image capture method is set to PhoneGap or PhoneGapPreferred. When an image file is captured using the PhoneGap the captured file is placed in a temporary storage location that could be cleared when the app is termitated. Therefore, it is advisable to move the file to a permanent location.

case.title: File system part2
case.description: This property appears if the Image capture method is set to PhoneGap or PhoneGapPreferred and is used with iOS. The 'public' option is the application's 'Documents directory', accessible in iTunes file sharing and backed up to the iCloud. The 'private' option relates to the application's private persisted data, which is deleted when the application is uninstalled. The 'saved' option is similar to 'private', but is backed up to iTunes.

case.title: Folder2
case.description: Specify the folder in the file system where the file should be stored.

case.title: Resize image
case.description: Specify the policy for resizing the image. The 'Always' option will cause the image to always be resized, regardless of its raw size. The 'Only If Image Exceeds Max Size' setting will cause the image to be resized only if the raw image size is greater than the maximum image size.

case.title: Image compression
case.description: Specify the image compression factor to use when capturing an image using HTML5. When set to '1' there will be no compression. For maximum compression use '0'.

case.title: Max image height
case.description: Specify the maximum image height (in pixels).

case.title: Max image width
case.description: Specify the maximum image width (in pixels).

case.title: Maximum image size (bytes)
case.description: Specify the maximum image size (in bytes) that can be captured. Set to -1 for no limit (NOT RECOMMENDED)

case.title: Picture source
case.description: Specify if the image should be captured by using the camera to take a picture, or if the user should select the image from the Photo Library on the device.

case.title: Save picture to photo album
case.description: When enabled, the image is saved to the device's photo library.

case.title: Image quality
case.description: Specify the image quality when using PhoneGap.

case.title: Allow picture editing after capture
case.description: Can the user edit the picture after capturing it?

case.title: Max image height
case.description: Specify the maximum image height (in pixels).

case.title: Max image width
case.description: Specify the maximum image width (in pixels).

item.name: Image selection canceled message
item.description: By default this reads 'Image Selection Canceled'

item.name: Camera canceled message
item.description: The default message is 'Camera Action Canceled'

case.title: Before image capture
case.description: Specify the Javascript to run before the image is captured. If your code contains 'return false;' then the image capture is cancelled.
